content: 1 A man there hath been in the land of Uz—Job his name—and that man hath been perfect and upright—both fearing God, and turning aside from evil.
content_old: 1 A man there hath been in the land of Uz—Job his name—and that man hath been perfect and upright—both fearing God, and turning aside from evil.

content: 2 And there are borne to him seven sons and three daughters,
content_old: 2 And there are borne to him seven sons and three daughters,

content: 3 and his substance is seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred pairs of oxen, and five hundred she-asses, and a service very abundant; and that man is greater than any of the sons of the east.
content_old: 3 and his substance is seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred pairs of oxen, and five hundred she-asses, and a service very abundant; and that man is greater than any of the sons of the east.

content: 4 And his sons have gone and made a banquet—the house of each in his day—and have sent and called to their three sisters to eat and to drink with them;
content_old: 4 And his sons have gone and made a banquet—the house of each in his day—and have sent and called to their three sisters to eat and to drink with them;

content: 5 and it cometh to pass, when they have gone round the days of the banquet, that Job doth send and sanctify them, and hath risen early in the morning, and caused to ascend burnt-offerings—the number of them all—for Job said, ‘Perhaps my sons have sinned, yet blessed God in their heart.’ Thus doth Job all the days.
content_old: 5 and it cometh to pass, when they have gone round the days of the banquet, that Job doth send and sanctify them, and hath risen early in the morning, and caused to ascend burnt-offerings—the number of them all—for Job said, ‘Perhaps my sons have sinned, yet blessed God in their heart.’ Thus doth Job all the days.

content: 6 And the day is, that sons of God come in to station themselves by Jehovah, and there doth come also the Adversary in their midst.
content_old: 6 And the day is, that sons of God come in to station themselves by Jehovah, and there doth come also the Adversary in their midst.

content: 7 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Whence comest thou?’ And the Adversary answereth Jehovah and saith, ‘From going to and fro in the land, and from walking up and down on it.’
content_old: 7 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Whence comest thou?’ And the Adversary answereth Jehovah and saith, ‘From going to and fro in the land, and from walking up and down on it.’

content: 8 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Hast thou set thy heart against My servant Job because there is none like him in the land, a man perfect and upright, fearing God, and turning aside from evil?’
content_old: 8 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Hast thou set thy heart against My servant Job because there is none like him in the land, a man perfect and upright, fearing God, and turning aside from evil?’

content: 9 And the Adversary answereth Jehovah and saith, ‘For nought is Job fearing God?
content_old: 9 And the Adversary answereth Jehovah and saith, ‘For nought is Job fearing God?

content: 10 Hast not Thou made a hedge for him, and for his house, and for all that he hath—round about?
content_old: 10 Hast not Thou made a hedge for him, and for his house, and for all that he hath—round about?

content: 11 The work of his hands Thou hast blessed, and his substance hath spread in the land, and yet, put forth, I pray Thee, Thy hand, and strike against anything that he hath—if not: to Thy face he doth bless Thee!’
content_old: 11 The work of his hands Thou hast blessed, and his substance hath spread in the land, and yet, put forth, I pray Thee, Thy hand, and strike against anything that he hath—if not: to Thy face he doth bless Thee!’

content: 12 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Lo, all that he hath is in thy hand, only unto him put not forth thy hand.’ And the Adversary goeth out from the presence of Jehovah.
content_old: 12 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Lo, all that he hath is in thy hand, only unto him put not forth thy hand.’ And the Adversary goeth out from the presence of Jehovah.

content: 13 And the day is, that his sons and his daughters are eating, and drinking wine, in the house of their brother, the first-born.
content_old: 13 And the day is, that his sons and his daughters are eating, and drinking wine, in the house of their brother, the first-born.

content: 14 And a messenger hath come in unto Job and saith, ‘The oxen have been plowing, and the she-asses feeding by their sides,
content_old: 14 And a messenger hath come in unto Job and saith, ‘The oxen have been plowing, and the she-asses feeding by their sides,

content: 15 and Sheba doth fall, and take them, and the young men they have smitten by the mouth of the sword, and I am escaped—only I alone—to declare it to thee.’
content_old: 15 and Sheba doth fall, and take them, and the young men they have smitten by the mouth of the sword, and I am escaped—only I alone—to declare it to thee.’

content: 16 While this one is speaking another also hath come and saith, ‘Fire of God hath fallen from the heavens, and burneth among the flock, and among the young men, and consumeth them, and I am escaped—only I alone—to declare it to thee.’
content_old: 16 While this one is speaking another also hath come and saith, ‘Fire of God hath fallen from the heavens, and burneth among the flock, and among the young men, and consumeth them, and I am escaped—only I alone—to declare it to thee.’

content: 17 While this one is speaking another also hath come and saith, ‘Chaldeans made three heads, and rush on the camels, and take them, and the young men they have smitten by the mouth of the sword, and I am escaped—only I alone—to declare it to thee.’
content_old: 17 While this one is speaking another also hath come and saith, ‘Chaldeans made three heads, and rush on the camels, and take them, and the young men they have smitten by the mouth of the sword, and I am escaped—only I alone—to declare it to thee.’

content: 18 While this one is speaking another also hath come and saith, ‘Thy sons and thy daughters are eating, and drinking wine, in the house of their brother, the first-born.
content_old: 18 While this one is speaking another also hath come and saith, ‘Thy sons and thy daughters are eating, and drinking wine, in the house of their brother, the first-born.

content: 19 And lo, a great wind hath come from over the wilderness, and striketh against the four corners of the house, and it falleth on the young men, and they are dead, and I am escaped—only I alone—to declare it to thee.’
content_old: 19 And lo, a great wind hath come from over the wilderness, and striketh against the four corners of the house, and it falleth on the young men, and they are dead, and I am escaped—only I alone—to declare it to thee.’

content: 20 And Job riseth, and rendeth his robe, and shaveth his head, and falleth to the earth, and doth obeisance,
content_old: 20 And Job riseth, and rendeth his robe, and shaveth his head, and falleth to the earth, and doth obeisance,

content: 21 and he saith, ‘Naked came I forth from the womb of my mother, and naked I turn back thither: Jehovah hath given and Jehovah hath taken: let the name of Jehovah be blessed.’
content_old: 21 and he saith, ‘Naked came I forth from the womb of my mother, and naked I turn back thither: Jehovah hath given and Jehovah hath taken: let the name of Jehovah be blessed.’

content: 1 And the day is, that sons of God come in to station themselves by Jehovah, and there doth come also the Adversary in their midst to station himself by Jehovah.
content_old: 1 And the day is, that sons of God come in to station themselves by Jehovah, and there doth come also the Adversary in their midst to station himself by Jehovah.

content: 2 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Whence camest thou?’ And the Adversary answereth Jehovah and saith, ‘From going to and fro in the land, and from walking up and down in it.’
content_old: 2 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Whence camest thou?’ And the Adversary answereth Jehovah and saith, ‘From going to and fro in the land, and from walking up and down in it.’

content: 3 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Hast thou set thy heart unto My servant Job because there is none like him in the land, a man perfect and upright, fearing God and turning aside from evil? and still he is keeping hold on his integrity, and thou dost move Me against him to swallow him up for nought!’
content_old: 3 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Hast thou set thy heart unto My servant Job because there is none like him in the land, a man perfect and upright, fearing God and turning aside from evil? and still he is keeping hold on his integrity, and thou dost move Me against him to swallow him up for nought!’

content: 4 And the Adversary answereth Jehovah and saith, ‘A skin for a skin, and all that a man hath he doth give for his life.
content_old: 4 And the Adversary answereth Jehovah and saith, ‘A skin for a skin, and all that a man hath he doth give for his life.

content: 5 Yet, put forth, I pray Thee, Thy hand, and strike unto his bone and unto his flesh—if not: unto Thy face he doth bless Thee!’
content_old: 5 Yet, put forth, I pray Thee, Thy hand, and strike unto his bone and unto his flesh—if not: unto Thy face he doth bless Thee!’

content: 6 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Lo, he is in thy hand; only his life take care of.’
content_old: 6 And Jehovah saith unto the Adversary, ‘Lo, he is in thy hand; only his life take care of.’

content: 7 And the Adversary goeth forth from the presence of Jehovah, and smiteth Job with a sore ulcer from the sole of his foot unto his crown.
content_old: 7 And the Adversary goeth forth from the presence of Jehovah, and smiteth Job with a sore ulcer from the sole of his foot unto his crown.

content: 8 And he taketh to him a potsherd to scrape himself with it, and he is sitting in the midst of the ashes.
content_old: 8 And he taketh to him a potsherd to scrape himself with it, and he is sitting in the midst of the ashes.

content: 9 And his wife saith to him, ‘Still thou art keeping hold on thine integrity: bless God and die.’
content_old: 9 And his wife saith to him, ‘Still thou art keeping hold on thine integrity: bless God and die.’

content: 10 And he saith unto her, ‘As one of the foolish women speaketh, thou speakest; yea, the good we receive from God, and the evil we do not receive.’ In all this Job hath not sinned with his lips.
content_old: 10 And he saith unto her, ‘As one of the foolish women speaketh, thou speakest; yea, the good we receive from God, and the evil we do not receive.’ In all this Job hath not sinned with his lips.

content: 11 And three of the friends of Job hear of all this evil that hath come upon him, and they come in each from his place—Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite—and they are met together to come in to bemoan him, and to comfort him;
content_old: 11 And three of the friends of Job hear of all this evil that hath come upon him, and they come in each from his place—Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite—and they are met together to come in to bemoan him, and to comfort him;

content: 12 and they lift up their eyes from afar and have not discerned him, and they lift up their voice and weep, and rend each his robe, and sprinkle dust on their heads—heavenward.
content_old: 12 and they lift up their eyes from afar and have not discerned him, and they lift up their voice and weep, and rend each his robe, and sprinkle dust on their heads—heavenward.

content: 1 After this hath Job opened his mouth, and revileth his day.
content_old: 1 After this hath Job opened his mouth, and revileth his day.

content: 2 And Job answereth and saith:—
content_old: 2 And Job answereth and saith:—

content: 3 Let the day perish in which I am born, And the night that hath said: ‘A man-child hath been conceived.’
content_old: 3 Let the day perish in which I am born, And the night that hath said: ‘A man-child hath been conceived.’

content: 4 That day—let it be darkness, Let not God require it from above, Nor let light shine upon it.
content_old: 4 That day—let it be darkness, Let not God require it from above, Nor let light shine upon it.

content: 5 Let darkness and death-shade redeem it, Let a cloud tabernacle upon it, Let them terrify it as the most bitter of days.
content_old: 5 Let darkness and death-shade redeem it, Let a cloud tabernacle upon it, Let them terrify it as the most bitter of days.

content: 6 That night—let thick darkness take it, Let it not be united to days of the year, Into the number of months let it not come.
content_old: 6 That night—let thick darkness take it, Let it not be united to days of the year, Into the number of months let it not come.

content: 7 Lo! that night—let it be gloomy, Let no singing come into it.
content_old: 7 Lo! that night—let it be gloomy, Let no singing come into it.

content: 8 Let the cursers of day mark it, Who are ready to wake up Leviathan.
content_old: 8 Let the cursers of day mark it, Who are ready to wake up Leviathan.

content: 9 Let the stars of its twilight be dark, Let it wait for light, and there is none, And let it not look on the eyelids of the dawn.
content_old: 9 Let the stars of its twilight be dark, Let it wait for light, and there is none, And let it not look on the eyelids of the dawn.

content: 10 Because it hath not shut the doors Of the womb that was mine! And hide misery from mine eyes.
content_old: 10 Because it hath not shut the doors Of the womb that was mine! And hide misery from mine eyes.

content: 11 Why from the womb do I not die? From the belly I have come forth and gasp!
content_old: 11 Why from the womb do I not die? From the belly I have come forth and gasp!

content: 12 Wherefore have knees been before me? And what are breasts, that I suck?
content_old: 12 Wherefore have knees been before me? And what are breasts, that I suck?

content: 13 For now, I have lain down, and am quiet, I have slept—then there is rest to me,
content_old: 13 For now, I have lain down, and am quiet, I have slept—then there is rest to me,

content: 14 With kings and counsellors of earth, These building wastes for themselves.
content_old: 14 With kings and counsellors of earth, These building wastes for themselves.

content: 15 Or with princes—they have gold, They are filling their houses with silver.
content_old: 15 Or with princes—they have gold, They are filling their houses with silver.

content: 16 (Or as a hidden abortion I am not, As infants—they have not seen light.)
content_old: 16 (Or as a hidden abortion I am not, As infants—they have not seen light.)

content: 17 There the wicked have ceased troubling, And there rest do the wearied in power.
content_old: 17 There the wicked have ceased troubling, And there rest do the wearied in power.

content: 18 Together prisoners have been at ease, They have not heard the voice of an exactor,
content_old: 18 Together prisoners have been at ease, They have not heard the voice of an exactor,

content: 19 Small and great are there the same. And a servant is free from his lord.
content_old: 19 Small and great are there the same. And a servant is free from his lord.

content: 20 Why giveth He to the miserable light, and life to the bitter soul?
content_old: 20 Why giveth He to the miserable light, and life to the bitter soul?

content: 21 Who are waiting for death, and it is not, And they seek it above hid treasures.
content_old: 21 Who are waiting for death, and it is not, And they seek it above hid treasures.

content: 22 Who are glad—unto joy, They rejoice when they find a grave.
content_old: 22 Who are glad—unto joy, They rejoice when they find a grave.

content: 23 To a man whose way hath been hidden, And whom God doth shut up?
content_old: 23 To a man whose way hath been hidden, And whom God doth shut up?

content: 24 For before my food, my sighing cometh, And poured out as waters are my roarings.
content_old: 24 For before my food, my sighing cometh, And poured out as waters are my roarings.

content: 25 For a fear I feared and it meeteth me, And what I was afraid of doth come to me.
content_old: 25 For a fear I feared and it meeteth me, And what I was afraid of doth come to me.

content: 1 And Eliphaz the Temanite answereth and saith:—
content_old: 1 And Eliphaz the Temanite answereth and saith:—

content: 2 Hath one tried a word with thee?—Thou art weary! And to keep in words who is able?
content_old: 2 Hath one tried a word with thee?—Thou art weary! And to keep in words who is able?

content: 3 Lo, thou hast instructed many, And feeble hands thou makest strong.
content_old: 3 Lo, thou hast instructed many, And feeble hands thou makest strong.

content: 4 The stumbling one do thy words raise up, And bowing knees thou dost strengthen.
content_old: 4 The stumbling one do thy words raise up, And bowing knees thou dost strengthen.

content: 5 But now, it cometh in unto thee, And thou art weary; It striketh unto thee, and thou art troubled.
content_old: 5 But now, it cometh in unto thee, And thou art weary; It striketh unto thee, and thou art troubled.

content: 6 Is not thy reverence thy confidence? Thy hope—the perfection of thy ways?
content_old: 6 Is not thy reverence thy confidence? Thy hope—the perfection of thy ways?

content: 7 Remember, I pray thee, Who, being innocent, hath perished? And where have the upright been cut off?
content_old: 7 Remember, I pray thee, Who, being innocent, hath perished? And where have the upright been cut off?

content: 8 As I have seen—ploughers of iniquity, And sowers of misery, reap it!
content_old: 8 As I have seen—ploughers of iniquity, And sowers of misery, reap it!

content: 9 From the breath of God they perish, And from the spirit of His anger consumed.
content_old: 9 From the breath of God they perish, And from the spirit of His anger consumed.

content: 10 The roaring of a lion, And the voice of a fierce lion, And teeth of young lions have been broken.
content_old: 10 The roaring of a lion, And the voice of a fierce lion, And teeth of young lions have been broken.

content: 11 An old lion is perishing without prey, And the whelps of the lioness do separate.
content_old: 11 An old lion is perishing without prey, And the whelps of the lioness do separate.

content: 12 And unto me a thing is secretly brought, And receive doth mine ear a little of it.
content_old: 12 And unto me a thing is secretly brought, And receive doth mine ear a little of it.

content: 13 In thoughts from visions of the night, In the falling of deep sleep on men,
content_old: 13 In thoughts from visions of the night, In the falling of deep sleep on men,

content: 14 Fear hath met me, and trembling, And the multitude of my bones caused to fear.
content_old: 14 Fear hath met me, and trembling, And the multitude of my bones caused to fear.

content: 15 And a spirit before my face doth pass, Stand up doth the hair of my flesh;
content_old: 15 And a spirit before my face doth pass, Stand up doth the hair of my flesh;

content: 16 It standeth, and I discern not its aspect, A similitude is over-against mine eyes, Silence! and a voice I hear:
content_old: 16 It standeth, and I discern not its aspect, A similitude is over-against mine eyes, Silence! and a voice I hear:

content: 17 ‘Is mortal man than God more righteous? Than his Maker is a man cleaner?
content_old: 17 ‘Is mortal man than God more righteous? Than his Maker is a man cleaner?

content: 18 Lo, in His servants He putteth no credence, Nor in His messengers setteth praise.’
content_old: 18 Lo, in His servants He putteth no credence, Nor in His messengers setteth praise.’

content: 19 Also—the inhabitants of houses of clay, (Whose foundation is in the dust, They bruise them before a moth.)
content_old: 19 Also—the inhabitants of houses of clay, (Whose foundation is in the dust, They bruise them before a moth.)

content: 20 From morning to evening are beaten down, Without any regarding, for ever they perish.
content_old: 20 From morning to evening are beaten down, Without any regarding, for ever they perish.

content: 1 Pray, call, is there any to answer thee? And unto which of the holy ones dost thou turn?
content_old: 1 Pray, call, is there any to answer thee? And unto which of the holy ones dost thou turn?

content: 2 For provocation slayeth the perverse, And envy putteth to death the simple,
content_old: 2 For provocation slayeth the perverse, And envy putteth to death the simple,

content: 3 I—I have seen the perverse taking root, And I mark his habitation straightway,
content_old: 3 I—I have seen the perverse taking root, And I mark his habitation straightway,

content: 4 Far are his sons from safety, And they are bruised in the gate, And there is no deliverer.
content_old: 4 Far are his sons from safety, And they are bruised in the gate, And there is no deliverer.

content: 5 Whose harvest the hungry doth eat, And even from the thorns taketh it, And the designing swallowed their wealth.
content_old: 5 Whose harvest the hungry doth eat, And even from the thorns taketh it, And the designing swallowed their wealth.

content: 6 For sorrow cometh not forth from the dust, Nor from the ground springeth up misery.
content_old: 6 For sorrow cometh not forth from the dust, Nor from the ground springeth up misery.

content: 7 For man to misery is born, And the sparks go high to fly.
content_old: 7 For man to misery is born, And the sparks go high to fly.

content: 8 Yet I—I inquire for God, And for God I give my word,
content_old: 8 Yet I—I inquire for God, And for God I give my word,

content: 9 Doing great things, and there is no searching. Wonderful, till there is no numbering.
content_old: 9 Doing great things, and there is no searching. Wonderful, till there is no numbering.

content: 10 Who is giving rain on the face of the land, And is sending waters on the out-places.
content_old: 10 Who is giving rain on the face of the land, And is sending waters on the out-places.

content: 11 To set the low on a high place, And the mourners have been high in safety.
content_old: 11 To set the low on a high place, And the mourners have been high in safety.

content: 12 Making void thoughts of the subtile, And their hands do not execute wisdom.
content_old: 12 Making void thoughts of the subtile, And their hands do not execute wisdom.

content: 13 Capturing the wise in their subtilty, And the counsel of wrestling ones was hastened,
content_old: 13 Capturing the wise in their subtilty, And the counsel of wrestling ones was hastened,

content: 14 By day they meet darkness, And as night—they grope at noon.
content_old: 14 By day they meet darkness, And as night—they grope at noon.

content: 15 And He saveth the wasted from their mouth, And from a strong hand the needy,
content_old: 15 And He saveth the wasted from their mouth, And from a strong hand the needy,

content: 16 And there is hope to the poor, And perverseness hath shut her mouth.
content_old: 16 And there is hope to the poor, And perverseness hath shut her mouth.

content: 17 Lo, the happiness of mortal man, God doth reprove him: And the chastisement of the Mighty despise not,
content_old: 17 Lo, the happiness of mortal man, God doth reprove him: And the chastisement of the Mighty despise not,

content: 18 For He doth pain, and He bindeth up, He smiteth, and His hands heal.
content_old: 18 For He doth pain, and He bindeth up, He smiteth, and His hands heal.

content: 19 In six distresses He delivereth thee, And in seven evil striketh not on thee.
content_old: 19 In six distresses He delivereth thee, And in seven evil striketh not on thee.

content: 20 In famine He hath redeemed thee from death, And in battle from the hands of the sword.
content_old: 20 In famine He hath redeemed thee from death, And in battle from the hands of the sword.

content: 21 When the tongue scourgeth thou art hid, And thou art not afraid of destruction, When it cometh.
content_old: 21 When the tongue scourgeth thou art hid, And thou art not afraid of destruction, When it cometh.

content: 22 At destruction and at hunger thou mockest, And of the beast of the earth, Thou art not afraid.
content_old: 22 At destruction and at hunger thou mockest, And of the beast of the earth, Thou art not afraid.

content: 23 (For with sons of the field is thy covenant, And the beast of the field Hath been at peace with thee.)
content_old: 23 (For with sons of the field is thy covenant, And the beast of the field Hath been at peace with thee.)

content: 24 And thou hast known that thy tent is peace, And inspected thy habitation, and errest not,
content_old: 24 And thou hast known that thy tent is peace, And inspected thy habitation, and errest not,

content: 25 And hast known that numerous is Thy seed, And thine offspring as the herb of the earth;
content_old: 25 And hast known that numerous is Thy seed, And thine offspring as the herb of the earth;

content: 26 Thou comest in full age unto the grave, As the going up of a stalk in its season.
content_old: 26 Thou comest in full age unto the grave, As the going up of a stalk in its season.

content: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—
content_old: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—

content: 2 O that my provocation were thoroughly weighed, And my calamity in balances They would lift up together!
content_old: 2 O that my provocation were thoroughly weighed, And my calamity in balances They would lift up together!

content: 3 For now, than the sands of the sea it is heavier, Therefore my words have been rash.
content_old: 3 For now, than the sands of the sea it is heavier, Therefore my words have been rash.

content: 4 For arrows of the Mighty are with me, Whose poison is drinking up my spirit. Terrors of God array themselves for me!
content_old: 4 For arrows of the Mighty are with me, Whose poison is drinking up my spirit. Terrors of God array themselves for me!

content: 5 Brayeth a wild ass over tender grass? Loweth an ox over his provender?
content_old: 5 Brayeth a wild ass over tender grass? Loweth an ox over his provender?

content: 6 Eaten is an insipid thing without salt? Is there sense in the drivel of dreams?
content_old: 6 Eaten is an insipid thing without salt? Is there sense in the drivel of dreams?

content: 7 My soul is refusing to touch! They are as my sickening food.
content_old: 7 My soul is refusing to touch! They are as my sickening food.

content: 8 O that my request may come, That God may grant my hope!
content_old: 8 O that my request may come, That God may grant my hope!

content: 9 That God would please—and bruise me, Loose His hand and cut me off!
content_old: 9 That God would please—and bruise me, Loose His hand and cut me off!

content: 10 And yet it is my comfort, (And I exult in pain—He doth not spare,) That I have not hidden The sayings of the Holy One.
content_old: 10 And yet it is my comfort, (And I exult in pain—He doth not spare,) That I have not hidden The sayings of the Holy One.

content: 11 What is my power that I should hope? And what mine end That I should prolong my life?
content_old: 11 What is my power that I should hope? And what mine end That I should prolong my life?

content: 12 Is my strength the strength of stones? Is my flesh brazen?
content_old: 12 Is my strength the strength of stones? Is my flesh brazen?

content: 13 Is not my help with me, And substance driven from me?
content_old: 13 Is not my help with me, And substance driven from me?

content: 14 To a despiser of his friends is shame, And the fear of the Mighty he forsaketh.
content_old: 14 To a despiser of his friends is shame, And the fear of the Mighty he forsaketh.

content: 15 My brethren have deceived as a brook, As a stream of brooks they pass away.
content_old: 15 My brethren have deceived as a brook, As a stream of brooks they pass away.

content: 16 That are black because of ice, By them doth snow hide itself.
content_old: 16 That are black because of ice, By them doth snow hide itself.

content: 17 By the time they are warm they have been cut off, By its being hot they have been Extinguished from their place.
content_old: 17 By the time they are warm they have been cut off, By its being hot they have been Extinguished from their place.

content: 18 Turn aside do the paths of their way, They ascend into emptiness, and are lost.
content_old: 18 Turn aside do the paths of their way, They ascend into emptiness, and are lost.

content: 19 Passengers of Tema looked expectingly, Travellers of Sheba hoped for them.
content_old: 19 Passengers of Tema looked expectingly, Travellers of Sheba hoped for them.

content: 20 They were ashamed that one hath trusted, They have come unto it and are confounded.
content_old: 20 They were ashamed that one hath trusted, They have come unto it and are confounded.

content: 21 Surely now ye have become the same! Ye see a downfall, and are afraid.
content_old: 21 Surely now ye have become the same! Ye see a downfall, and are afraid.

content: 22 Is it because I said, Give to me? And, By your power bribe for me?
content_old: 22 Is it because I said, Give to me? And, By your power bribe for me?

content: 23 And, Deliver me from the hand of an adversary? And, From the hand of terrible ones ransom me?
content_old: 23 And, Deliver me from the hand of an adversary? And, From the hand of terrible ones ransom me?

content: 26 For reproof—do you reckon words? And for wind—sayings of the desperate.

content: 27 Anger on the fatherless ye cause to fall, And are strange to your friend.

content: 1 Is there not a warfare to man on earth? And as the days of an hireling his days?
content_old: 1 Is there not a warfare to man on earth? And as the days of an hireling his days?

content: 2 As a servant desireth the shadow, And as a hireling expecteth his wage,
content_old: 2 As a servant desireth the shadow, And as a hireling expecteth his wage,

content: 3 So I have been caused to inherit months of vanity, And nights of misery they numbered to me.
content_old: 3 So I have been caused to inherit months of vanity, And nights of misery they numbered to me.

content: 4 If I lay down then I said, ‘When do I rise!’ And evening hath been measured, And I have been full of tossings till dawn.
content_old: 4 If I lay down then I said, ‘When do I rise!’ And evening hath been measured, And I have been full of tossings till dawn.

content: 5 Clothed hath been my flesh with worms, And a clod of dust, My skin hath been shrivelled and is loathsome,

content: 6 My days swifter than a weaving machine, And they are consumed without hope.

content: 7 Remember Thou that my life is a breath, Mine eye turneth not back to see good.
content_old: 7 Remember Thou that my life is a breath, Mine eye turneth not back to see good.

content: 8 The eye of my beholder beholdeth me not. Thine eyes are upon me—and I am not.
content_old: 8 The eye of my beholder beholdeth me not. Thine eyes are upon me—and I am not.

content: 9 Consumed hath been a cloud, and it goeth, So he who is going down to Sheol cometh not up.

content: 11 Also I—I withhold not my mouth—I speak in the distress of my spirit, I talk in the bitterness of my soul.
content_old: 11 Also I—I withhold not my mouth—I speak in the distress of my spirit, I talk in the bitterness of my soul.

content: 12 A sea -monster am I, or a dragon, That thou settest over me a guard?

content: 13 When I said, ‘My bed doth comfort me,’ He taketh away in my talking my couch.
content_old: 13 When I said, ‘My bed doth comfort me,’ He taketh away in my talking my couch.

content: 14 And thou hast affrighted me with dreams, And from visions thou terrifiest me,
content_old: 14 And thou hast affrighted me with dreams, And from visions thou terrifiest me,

content: 15 And my soul chooseth strangling, Death rather than my bones.
content_old: 15 And my soul chooseth strangling, Death rather than my bones.

content: 16 I have wasted away—not to the age do I live. Cease from me, for my days are vanity.

content: 17 What is man that Thou dost magnify him? And that Thou settest unto him Thy heart?
content_old: 17 What is man that Thou dost magnify him? And that Thou settest unto him Thy heart?

content: 18 And inspectest him in the mornings, In the evenings dost try him?
content_old: 18 And inspectest him in the mornings, In the evenings dost try him?

content: 19 How long dost Thou not look from me? Thou dost not desist till I swallow my spittle.

content: 20 I have sinned, what do I to Thee, O watcher of man? Why hast Thou set me for a mark to Thee, And I am for a burden to myself—and what?

content: 3 Doth God pervert judgment? And doth the Mighty One pervert justice?
content_old: 3 Doth God pervert judgment? And doth the Mighty One pervert justice?

content: 4 If thy sons have sinned before Him, And He doth send them away, By the hand of their transgression,
content_old: 4 If thy sons have sinned before Him, And He doth send them away, By the hand of their transgression,

content_old: 5 If thou dost seek early unto God, And unto the Mighty makest supplication,

content: 7 And thy beginning hath been small, And thy latter end is very great.
content_old: 7 And thy beginning hath been small, And thy latter end is very great.

content: 8 For, ask I pray thee of a former generation, And prepare to a search of their fathers,
content_old: 8 For, ask I pray thee of a former generation, And prepare to a search of their fathers,

content: 9 (For of yesterday we are, and we know not, For a shadow are our days on earth.)
content_old: 9 (For of yesterday we are, and we know not, For a shadow are our days on earth.)

content: 10 Do they not shew thee—speak to thee, And from their heart bring forth words?
content_old: 10 Do they not shew thee—speak to thee, And from their heart bring forth words?

content: 11 ‘Doth a rush wise without mire? A reed increase without water?
content_old: 11 ‘Doth a rush wise without mire? A reed increase without water?

content: 12 While it is in its budding—uncropped, Even before any herb it withereth.
content_old: 12 While it is in its budding—uncropped, Even before any herb it withereth.

content: 13 So are the paths of all forgetting God, And the hope of the profane doth perish,
content_old: 13 So are the paths of all forgetting God, And the hope of the profane doth perish,

content: 14 Whose confidence is loathsome, And the house of a spider his trust.
content_old: 14 Whose confidence is loathsome, And the house of a spider his trust.

content: 15 He leaneth on his house—and it standeth not: He taketh hold on it—and it abideth not.
content_old: 15 He leaneth on his house—and it standeth not: He taketh hold on it—and it abideth not.

content: 16 Green he is before the sun, And over his garden his branch goeth out.
content_old: 16 Green he is before the sun, And over his garden his branch goeth out.

content: 17 By a heap his roots are wrapped, A house of stones he looketh for.
content_old: 17 By a heap his roots are wrapped, A house of stones he looketh for.

content: 18 If one doth destroy him from his place, Then it hath feigned concerning him, I have not seen thee!
content_old: 18 If one doth destroy him from his place, Then it hath feigned concerning him, I have not seen thee!

content: 19 Lo, this is the joy of his way, And from the dust others spring up.’
content_old: 19 Lo, this is the joy of his way, And from the dust others spring up.’

content: 20 Lo, God doth not reject the perfect, Nor taketh hold on the hand of evil doers.
content_old: 20 Lo, God doth not reject the perfect, Nor taketh hold on the hand of evil doers.

content: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—

content: 3 If he delight to strive with Him—He doth not answer him one of a thousand.
content_old: 3 If he delight to strive with Him—He doth not answer him one of a thousand.

content: 4 Wise in heart and strong in power—Who hath hardened toward Him and is at peace?
content_old: 4 Wise in heart and strong in power—Who hath hardened toward Him and is at peace?

content: 5 Who is removing mountains, And they have not known, Who hath overturned them in His anger.

content: 6 Who is shaking earth from its place, And its pillars move themselves.

content: 8 Stretching out the heavens by Himself, And treading on the heights of the sea,

content: 9 Making Osh, Kesil, and Kimah, And the inner chambers of the south.
content_old: 9 Making Osh, Kesil, and Kimah, And the inner chambers of the south.

content_old: 10 Doing great things till there is no searching, And wonderful, till there is no numbering.

content_old: 12 Lo, He snatches away, who bringeth it back? Who saith unto Him, ‘What dost Thou?’

content_old: 13 God doth not turn back His anger, Under Him bowed have proud helpers.

content_old: 14 How much less do I—I answer Him? Choose out my words with Him?

content: 15 Whom, though I were righteous, I answer not, For my judgment I make supplication.

content_old: 3 Is it good for Thee that Thou dost oppress? That Thou despisest the labour of Thy hands, And on the counsel of the wicked hast shone?

content_old: 5 As the days of man are Thy days? Thy years as the days of a man?

content_old: 7 For Thou knowest that I am not wicked, And there is no deliverer from Thy hand.

content_old: 9 Remember, I pray Thee, That as clay Thou hast made me, And unto dust Thou dost bring me back.

content_old: 10 Dost Thou not as milk pour me out? And as cheese curdle me?

content_old: 3 Thy devices make men keep silent, Thou scornest, and none is causing blushing!

content_old: 4 And thou sayest, ‘Pure is my discourse, And clean I have been in Thine eyes.’

content_old: 8 Heights of the heavens!—what dost thou? Deeper than Sheol!—what knowest thou?

content_old: 10 If He pass on, and shut up, and assemble, Who then dost reverse it?

content_old: 11 For he hath known men of vanity, And He seeth iniquity, And one doth not consider it!

content_old: 14 If iniquity is in thy hand, put it far off, And let not perverseness dwell in thy tents.

content: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—

content: 1 Lo, all—hath mine eye seen, Heard hath mine ear, and it attendeth to it.

content: 5 O that ye would keep perfectly silent, And it would be to you for wisdom.
content_old: 5 O that ye would keep perfectly silent, And it would be to you for wisdom.

content: 6 Hear, I pray you, my argument, And to the pleadings of my lips attend,
content_old: 6 Hear, I pray you, my argument, And to the pleadings of my lips attend,

content: 7 For God do ye speak perverseness? And for Him do ye speak deceit?
content_old: 7 For God do ye speak perverseness? And for Him do ye speak deceit?

content: 8 His face do ye accept, if for God ye strive?
content_old: 8 His face do ye accept, if for God ye strive?

content: 9 Is it good that He doth search you, If, as one mocketh at a man, ye mock at Him?
content_old: 9 Is it good that He doth search you, If, as one mocketh at a man, ye mock at Him?

content: 10 He doth surely reprove you, if in secret ye accept faces.
content_old: 10 He doth surely reprove you, if in secret ye accept faces.

content: 11 Doth not His excellency terrify you? And His dread fall upon you?
content_old: 11 Doth not His excellency terrify you? And His dread fall upon you?

content: 12 Your remembrances are similes of ashes, For high places of clay your heights.
content_old: 12 Your remembrances are similes of ashes, For high places of clay your heights.

content: 13 Keep silent from me, and I speak, And pass over me doth what?
content_old: 13 Keep silent from me, and I speak, And pass over me doth what?

content: 14 Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth? And my soul put in my hand?
content_old: 14 Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth? And my soul put in my hand?

content: 15 Lo, He doth slay me—I wait not! Only, my ways unto His face I argue.
content_old: 15 Lo, He doth slay me—I wait not! Only, my ways unto His face I argue.

content: 16 Also—He is to me for salvation, For the profane cometh not before Him.
content_old: 16 Also—He is to me for salvation, For the profane cometh not before Him.

content: 17 Hear ye diligently my word, And my declaration with your ears.
content_old: 17 Hear ye diligently my word, And my declaration with your ears.

content: 18 Lo, I pray you, I have set in order the cause, I have known that I am righteous.
content_old: 18 Lo, I pray you, I have set in order the cause, I have known that I am righteous.

content: 19 Who is he that doth strive with me? For now I keep silent and gasp.
content_old: 19 Who is he that doth strive with me? For now I keep silent and gasp.

content: 20 Only two things, O God, do with me: Then from Thy face I am not hidden.
content_old: 20 Only two things, O God, do with me: Then from Thy face I am not hidden.

content: 21 Thy hand put far off from me, And Thy terror let not terrify me.
content_old: 21 Thy hand put far off from me, And Thy terror let not terrify me.

content: 22 And call Thou, and I—I answer, Or—I speak, and answer Thou me.
content_old: 22 And call Thou, and I—I answer, Or—I speak, and answer Thou me.

content: 23 How many iniquities and sins have I? My transgression and my sin let me know.
content_old: 23 How many iniquities and sins have I? My transgression and my sin let me know.

content: 24 Why dost Thou hide Thy face? And reckonest me for an enemy to Thee?
content_old: 24 Why dost Thou hide Thy face? And reckonest me for an enemy to Thee?

content: 25 A leaf driven away dost Thou terrify? And the dry stubble dost Thou pursue?
content_old: 25 A leaf driven away dost Thou terrify? And the dry stubble dost Thou pursue?

content: 26 For Thou writest against me bitter things, And causest me to possess iniquities of my youth:
content_old: 26 For Thou writest against me bitter things, And causest me to possess iniquities of my youth:

content: 27 And puttest in the stocks my feet, And observest all my paths, On the roots of my feet Thou settest a print,
content_old: 27 And puttest in the stocks my feet, And observest all my paths, On the roots of my feet Thou settest a print,

content: 1 Man, born of woman! Of few days, and full of trouble!
content_old: 1 Man, born of woman! Of few days, and full of trouble!

content: 2 As a flower he hath gone forth, and is cut off, And he fleeth as a shadow and standeth not.
content_old: 2 As a flower he hath gone forth, and is cut off, And he fleeth as a shadow and standeth not.

content: 3 Also—on this Thou hast opened Thine eyes, And dost bring me into judgment with Thee.
content_old: 3 Also—on this Thou hast opened Thine eyes, And dost bring me into judgment with Thee.

content: 4 Who giveth a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.
content_old: 4 Who giveth a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.

content: 5 If determined are his days, The number of his months are with Thee, His limit Thou hast made, And he passeth not over;
content_old: 5 If determined are his days, The number of his months are with Thee, His limit Thou hast made, And he passeth not over;

content: 6 Look away from off him that he may cease, Till he enjoy as an hireling his day.
content_old: 6 Look away from off him that he may cease, Till he enjoy as an hireling his day.

content: 7 For there is of a tree hope, if it be cut down, That again it doth change, That its tender branch doth not cease.
content_old: 7 For there is of a tree hope, if it be cut down, That again it doth change, That its tender branch doth not cease.

content: 8 If its root becometh old in the earth, And its stem doth die in the dust,
content_old: 8 If its root becometh old in the earth, And its stem doth die in the dust,

content: 9 From the fragrance of water it doth flourish, And hath made a crop as a plant.
content_old: 9 From the fragrance of water it doth flourish, And hath made a crop as a plant.

content: 10 And a man dieth, and becometh weak, And man expireth, and where is he?
content_old: 10 And a man dieth, and becometh weak, And man expireth, and where is he?

content: 11 Waters have gone away from a sea, And a river becometh waste and dry.
content_old: 11 Waters have gone away from a sea, And a river becometh waste and dry.

content: 12 And man hath lain down, and riseth not, Till the wearing out of the heavens they awake not, Nor are roused from their sleep.
content_old: 12 And man hath lain down, and riseth not, Till the wearing out of the heavens they awake not, Nor are roused from their sleep.

content: 13 O that in Sheol Thou wouldest conceal me, Hide me till the turning of Thine anger, Set for me a limit, and remember me.
content_old: 13 O that in Sheol Thou wouldest conceal me, Hide me till the turning of Thine anger, Set for me a limit, and remember me.

content: 14 If a man dieth—doth he revive? All days of my warfare I wait, till my change come.
content_old: 14 If a man dieth—doth he revive? All days of my warfare I wait, till my change come.

content: 15 Thou dost call, and I—I answer Thee; To the work of Thy hands Thou hast desire.
content_old: 15 Thou dost call, and I—I answer Thee; To the work of Thy hands Thou hast desire.

content: 16 But now, my steps Thou numberest, Thou dost not watch over my sin.
content_old: 16 But now, my steps Thou numberest, Thou dost not watch over my sin.

content: 17 Sealed up in a bag is my transgression, And Thou sewest up mine iniquity.
content_old: 17 Sealed up in a bag is my transgression, And Thou sewest up mine iniquity.

content: 18 And yet, a falling mountain wasteth away, And a rock is removed from its place.
content_old: 18 And yet, a falling mountain wasteth away, And a rock is removed from its place.

content: 19 Stones have waters worn away, Their outpourings wash away the dust of earth, And the hope of man Thou hast destroyed.
content_old: 19 Stones have waters worn away, Their outpourings wash away the dust of earth, And the hope of man Thou hast destroyed.

content: 20 Thou prevailest over him for ever, and he goeth, He is changing his countenance, And Thou sendest him away.
content_old: 20 Thou prevailest over him for ever, and he goeth, He is changing his countenance, And Thou sendest him away.

content: 21 Honoured are his sons, and he knoweth not; And they are little, and he attendeth not to them.
content_old: 21 Honoured are his sons, and he knoweth not; And they are little, and he attendeth not to them.

content: 1 And Eliphaz the Temanite answereth and saith:—
content_old: 1 And Eliphaz the Temanite answereth and saith:—

content: 2 Doth a wise man answer with vain knowledge? And fill with an east wind his belly?
content_old: 2 Doth a wise man answer with vain knowledge? And fill with an east wind his belly?

content: 3 To reason with a word not useful? And speeches—no profit in them?
content_old: 3 To reason with a word not useful? And speeches—no profit in them?

content: 4 Yea, thou dost make reverence void, And dost diminish meditation before God.
content_old: 4 Yea, thou dost make reverence void, And dost diminish meditation before God.

content: 5 For thy mouth teacheth thine iniquity, And thou chooseth the tongue of the subtile.
content_old: 5 For thy mouth teacheth thine iniquity, And thou chooseth the tongue of the subtile.

content: 6 Thy mouth declareth thee wicked, and not I, And thy lips testify against thee.
content_old: 6 Thy mouth declareth thee wicked, and not I, And thy lips testify against thee.

content: 7 The first man art thou born? And before the heights wast thou formed?
content_old: 7 The first man art thou born? And before the heights wast thou formed?

content: 8 Of the secret counsel of God dost thou hear? And withdrawest thou unto thee wisdom?
content_old: 8 Of the secret counsel of God dost thou hear? And withdrawest thou unto thee wisdom?

content: 9 What hast thou known, and we know not? Understandest thou—and it is not with us?
content_old: 9 What hast thou known, and we know not? Understandest thou—and it is not with us?

content: 10 Both the gray-headed And the very aged are among us—Greater than thy father in days.
content_old: 10 Both the gray-headed And the very aged are among us—Greater than thy father in days.

content: 11 Too few for thee are the comforts of God? And a gentle word is with thee,
content_old: 11 Too few for thee are the comforts of God? And a gentle word is with thee,

content: 12 What—doth thine heart take thee away? And what—are thine eyes high?
content_old: 12 What—doth thine heart take thee away? And what—are thine eyes high?

content: 13 For thou turnest against God thy spirit? And hast brought out words from thy mouth:
content_old: 13 For thou turnest against God thy spirit? And hast brought out words from thy mouth:

content: 14 What is man that he is pure, And that he is righteous, one born of woman?
content_old: 14 What is man that he is pure, And that he is righteous, one born of woman?

content: 15 Lo, in His holy ones He putteth no credence, And the heavens have not been pure in His eyes.
content_old: 15 Lo, in His holy ones He putteth no credence, And the heavens have not been pure in His eyes.

content: 16 Also—surely abominable and filthy Is man drinking as water perverseness.
content_old: 16 Also—surely abominable and filthy Is man drinking as water perverseness.

content: 17 I shew thee—hearken to me—And this I have seen and declare:
content_old: 17 I shew thee—hearken to me—And this I have seen and declare:

content: 18 Which the wise declare—And have not hid—from their fathers.
content_old: 18 Which the wise declare—And have not hid—from their fathers.

content: 19 To them alone was the land given, And a stranger passed not over into their midst:
content_old: 19 To them alone was the land given, And a stranger passed not over into their midst:

content: 20 ‘All days of the wicked he is paining himself, And few years have been laid up for the terrible one.
content_old: 20 ‘All days of the wicked he is paining himself, And few years have been laid up for the terrible one.

content: 21 A fearful voice is in his ears, In peace doth a destroyer come to him.
content_old: 21 A fearful voice is in his ears, In peace doth a destroyer come to him.

content: 22 He believeth not to return from darkness, And watched is he for the sword.
content_old: 22 He believeth not to return from darkness, And watched is he for the sword.

content: 23 He is wandering for bread—‘Where is it?’ He hath known that ready at his hand Is a day of darkness.
content_old: 23 He is wandering for bread—‘Where is it?’ He hath known that ready at his hand Is a day of darkness.

content: 24 Terrify him do adversity and distress, They prevail over him As a king ready for a boaster.
content_old: 24 Terrify him do adversity and distress, They prevail over him As a king ready for a boaster.

content: 25 For he stretched out against God his hand, And against the Mighty he maketh himself mighty.
content_old: 25 For he stretched out against God his hand, And against the Mighty he maketh himself mighty.

content: 26 He runneth unto Him with a neck, With thick bosses of his shields.
content_old: 26 He runneth unto Him with a neck, With thick bosses of his shields.

content: 27 For he hath covered his face with his fat, And maketh vigour over his confidence.
content_old: 27 For he hath covered his face with his fat, And maketh vigour over his confidence.

content: 28 And he inhabiteth cities cut off, houses not dwelt in, That have been ready to become heaps.
content_old: 28 And he inhabiteth cities cut off, houses not dwelt in, That have been ready to become heaps.

content: 29 He is not rich, nor doth his wealth rise, Nor doth he stretch out on earth their continuance.
content_old: 29 He is not rich, nor doth his wealth rise, Nor doth he stretch out on earth their continuance.

content: 30 He turneth not aside from darkness, His tender branch doth a flame dry up, And he turneth aside at the breath of His mouth!
content_old: 30 He turneth not aside from darkness, His tender branch doth a flame dry up, And he turneth aside at the breath of His mouth!

content: 31 Let him not put credence in vanity, He hath been deceived, For vanity is his recompence.
content_old: 31 Let him not put credence in vanity, He hath been deceived, For vanity is his recompence.

content: 32 Not in his day is it completed, And his bending branch is not green.
content_old: 32 Not in his day is it completed, And his bending branch is not green.

content: 33 He shaketh off as a vine his unripe fruit, And casteth off as an olive his blossom.
content_old: 33 He shaketh off as a vine his unripe fruit, And casteth off as an olive his blossom.

content: 34 For the company of the profane is gloomy, And fire hath consumed tents of bribery.
content_old: 34 For the company of the profane is gloomy, And fire hath consumed tents of bribery.

content: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—
content_old: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—

content: 2 I have heard many such things, Miserable comforters are ye all.
content_old: 2 I have heard many such things, Miserable comforters are ye all.

content: 3 Is there an end to words of wind? Or what doth embolden thee that thou answerest?
content_old: 3 Is there an end to words of wind? Or what doth embolden thee that thou answerest?

content: 4 I also, like you, might speak, If your soul were in my soul’s stead. I might join against you with words, And nod at you with my head.
content_old: 4 I also, like you, might speak, If your soul were in my soul’s stead. I might join against you with words, And nod at you with my head.

content: 5 I might harden you with my mouth, And the moving of my lips might be sparing.
content_old: 5 I might harden you with my mouth, And the moving of my lips might be sparing.

content: 6 If I speak, my pain is not restrained, And I cease—what goeth from me?
content_old: 6 If I speak, my pain is not restrained, And I cease—what goeth from me?

content: 7 Only, now, it hath wearied me; Thou hast desolated all my company,
content_old: 7 Only, now, it hath wearied me; Thou hast desolated all my company,

content: 8 And Thou dost loathe me, For a witness it hath been, And rise up against me doth my failure, In my face it testifieth.
content_old: 8 And Thou dost loathe me, For a witness it hath been, And rise up against me doth my failure, In my face it testifieth.

content: 9 His anger hath torn, and he hateth me, He hath gnashed at me with his teeth, My adversary sharpeneth his eyes for me.
content_old: 9 His anger hath torn, and he hateth me, He hath gnashed at me with his teeth, My adversary sharpeneth his eyes for me.

content: 10 They have gaped on me with their mouth, In reproach they have smitten my cheeks, Together against me they set themselves.
content_old: 10 They have gaped on me with their mouth, In reproach they have smitten my cheeks, Together against me they set themselves.

content: 11 God shutteth me up unto the perverse, And to the hands of the wicked turneth me over.
content_old: 11 God shutteth me up unto the perverse, And to the hands of the wicked turneth me over.

content: 12 At ease I have been, and he breaketh me, And he hath laid hold on my neck, And he breaketh me in pieces, And he raiseth me to him for a mark.
content_old: 12 At ease I have been, and he breaketh me, And he hath laid hold on my neck, And he breaketh me in pieces, And he raiseth me to him for a mark.

content: 13 Go round against me do his archers. He splitteth my reins, and spareth not, He poureth out to the earth my gall.
content_old: 13 Go round against me do his archers. He splitteth my reins, and spareth not, He poureth out to the earth my gall.

content: 14 He breaketh me—breach upon breach, He runneth upon me as a mighty one.
content_old: 14 He breaketh me—breach upon breach, He runneth upon me as a mighty one.

content: 15 Sackcloth I have sewed on my skin, And have rolled in the dust my horn.
content_old: 15 Sackcloth I have sewed on my skin, And have rolled in the dust my horn.

content: 16 My face is foul with weeping, And on mine eyelids is death-shade.
content_old: 16 My face is foul with weeping, And on mine eyelids is death-shade.

content: 17 Not for violence in my hands, And my prayer is pure.
content_old: 17 Not for violence in my hands, And my prayer is pure.

content: 18 O earth, do not thou cover my blood! And let there not be a place for my cry.
content_old: 18 O earth, do not thou cover my blood! And let there not be a place for my cry.

content: 19 Also, now, lo, in the heavens is my witness, And my testifier in the high places.
content_old: 19 Also, now, lo, in the heavens is my witness, And my testifier in the high places.

content: 20 My interpreter is my friend, Unto God hath mine eye dropped:
content_old: 20 My interpreter is my friend, Unto God hath mine eye dropped:

content: 21 And he reasoneth for a man with God, And a son of man for his friend.
content_old: 21 And he reasoneth for a man with God, And a son of man for his friend.

content: 1 My spirit hath been destroyed, My days extinguished—graves are for me.
content_old: 1 My spirit hath been destroyed, My days extinguished—graves are for me.

content: 2 If not—mockeries are with me. And in their provocations mine eye lodgeth.
content_old: 2 If not—mockeries are with me. And in their provocations mine eye lodgeth.

content: 3 Place, I pray Thee, my pledge with Thee; Who is he that striketh hand with me?
content_old: 3 Place, I pray Thee, my pledge with Thee; Who is he that striketh hand with me?

content: 4 For their heart Thou hast hidden From understanding, Therefore Thou dost not exalt them.
content_old: 4 For their heart Thou hast hidden From understanding, Therefore Thou dost not exalt them.

content: 5 For a portion he sheweth friendship, And the eyes of his sons are consumed.
content_old: 5 For a portion he sheweth friendship, And the eyes of his sons are consumed.

content: 6 And he set me up for a proverb of the peoples, And a wonder before them I am.
content_old: 6 And he set me up for a proverb of the peoples, And a wonder before them I am.

content: 7 And dim from sorrow is mine eye, And my members as a shadow all of them.
content_old: 7 And dim from sorrow is mine eye, And my members as a shadow all of them.

content: 8 Astonished are the upright at this, And the innocent against the profane Stirreth himself up.
content_old: 8 Astonished are the upright at this, And the innocent against the profane Stirreth himself up.

content: 9 And the righteous layeth hold on his way, And the clean of hands addeth strength, And—dumb are they all.
content_old: 9 And the righteous layeth hold on his way, And the clean of hands addeth strength, And—dumb are they all.

content: 10 Return, and come in, I pray you, And I find not among you a wise man.
content_old: 10 Return, and come in, I pray you, And I find not among you a wise man.

content: 11 My days have passed by, My devices have been broken off, The possessions of my heart!
content_old: 11 My days have passed by, My devices have been broken off, The possessions of my heart!

content: 12 Night for day they appoint, Light is near because of darkness.
content_old: 12 Night for day they appoint, Light is near because of darkness.

content: 13 If I wait—Sheol is my house, In darkness I have spread out my couch.
content_old: 13 If I wait—Sheol is my house, In darkness I have spread out my couch.

content: 14 To corruption I have called:—‘Thou art my father.’ ‘My mother’ and ‘my sister’—to the worm.
content_old: 14 To corruption I have called:—‘Thou art my father.’ ‘My mother’ and ‘my sister’—to the worm.

content: 15 And where is now my hope? Yea, my hope, who doth behold it?
content_old: 15 And where is now my hope? Yea, my hope, who doth behold it?

content: 1 And Bildad the Shuhite answereth and saith:—
content_old: 1 And Bildad the Shuhite answereth and saith:—

content: 2 When do ye set an end to words? Consider ye, and afterwards do we speak.
content_old: 2 When do ye set an end to words? Consider ye, and afterwards do we speak.

content: 3 Wherefore have we been reckoned as cattle? We have been defiled in your eyes!
content_old: 3 Wherefore have we been reckoned as cattle? We have been defiled in your eyes!

content: 4 (He is tearing himself in his anger.) For thy sake is earth forsaken? And removed is a rock from its place?
content_old: 4 (He is tearing himself in his anger.) For thy sake is earth forsaken? And removed is a rock from its place?

content: 5 Also, the light of the wicked is extinguished. And there doth not shine a spark of his fire.
content_old: 5 Also, the light of the wicked is extinguished. And there doth not shine a spark of his fire.

content: 6 The light hath been dark in his tent, And his lamp over him is extinguished.
content_old: 6 The light hath been dark in his tent, And his lamp over him is extinguished.

content: 7 Straitened are the steps of his strength, And cast him down doth his own counsel.
content_old: 7 Straitened are the steps of his strength, And cast him down doth his own counsel.

content: 8 For he is sent into a net by his own feet, And on a snare he doth walk habitually.
content_old: 8 For he is sent into a net by his own feet, And on a snare he doth walk habitually.

content: 9 Seize on the heel doth a gin, Prevail over him do the designing.
content_old: 9 Seize on the heel doth a gin, Prevail over him do the designing.

content: 10 Hidden in the earth is his cord, And his trap on the path.
content_old: 10 Hidden in the earth is his cord, And his trap on the path.

content: 11 Round about terrified him have terrors, And they have scattered him—at his feet.
content_old: 11 Round about terrified him have terrors, And they have scattered him—at his feet.

content: 12 Hungry is his sorrow, And calamity is ready at his side.
content_old: 12 Hungry is his sorrow, And calamity is ready at his side.

content: 13 It consumeth the parts of his skin, Consume his parts doth death’s first-born.
content_old: 13 It consumeth the parts of his skin, Consume his parts doth death’s first-born.

content: 14 Drawn from his tent is his confidence, And it causeth him to step to the king of terrors.
content_old: 14 Drawn from his tent is his confidence, And it causeth him to step to the king of terrors.

content: 15 It dwelleth in his tent—out of his provender, Scattered over his habitation is sulphur.
content_old: 15 It dwelleth in his tent—out of his provender, Scattered over his habitation is sulphur.

content: 16 From beneath his roots are dried up, And from above cut off is his crop.
content_old: 16 From beneath his roots are dried up, And from above cut off is his crop.

content: 17 His memorial hath perished from the land, And he hath no name on the street.
content_old: 17 His memorial hath perished from the land, And he hath no name on the street.

content: 18 They thrust him from light unto darkness, And from the habitable earth cast him out.
content_old: 18 They thrust him from light unto darkness, And from the habitable earth cast him out.

content: 19 He hath no continuator, Nor successor among his people, And none is remaining in his dwellings.
content_old: 19 He hath no continuator, Nor successor among his people, And none is remaining in his dwellings.

content: 20 At this day westerns have been astonished And easterns have taken fright.
content_old: 20 At this day westerns have been astonished And easterns have taken fright.

content: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—
content_old: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—

content: 2 Till when do ye afflict my soul, And bruise me with words?
content_old: 2 Till when do ye afflict my soul, And bruise me with words?

content: 3 These ten times ye put me to shame, ye blush not. Ye make yourselves strange to me—
content_old: 3 These ten times ye put me to shame, ye blush not. Ye make yourselves strange to me—

content: 4 And also—truly, I have erred, With me doth my error remain.
content_old: 4 And also—truly, I have erred, With me doth my error remain.

content: 5 If, truly, over me ye magnify yourselves, And decide against me my reproach;
content_old: 5 If, truly, over me ye magnify yourselves, And decide against me my reproach;

content: 6 Know now, that God turned me upside down, And His net against me hath set round,
content_old: 6 Know now, that God turned me upside down, And His net against me hath set round,

content: 7 Lo, I cry out—violence, and am not answered, I cry aloud, and there is no judgment.
content_old: 7 Lo, I cry out—violence, and am not answered, I cry aloud, and there is no judgment.

content: 8 My way He hedged up, and I pass not over, And on my paths darkness He placeth.
content_old: 8 My way He hedged up, and I pass not over, And on my paths darkness He placeth.

content: 9 Mine honour from off me He hath stripped, And He turneth the crown from my head.
content_old: 9 Mine honour from off me He hath stripped, And He turneth the crown from my head.

content: 10 He breaketh me down round about, and I go, And removeth like a tree my hope.
content_old: 10 He breaketh me down round about, and I go, And removeth like a tree my hope.

content: 11 And He kindleth against me His anger, And reckoneth me to Him as His adversaries.
content_old: 11 And He kindleth against me His anger, And reckoneth me to Him as His adversaries.

content: 12 Come in do His troops together, And they raise up against me their way, And encamp round about my tent.
content_old: 12 Come in do His troops together, And they raise up against me their way, And encamp round about my tent.

content: 13 My brethren from me He hath put far off, And mine acquaintances surely Have been estranged from me.
content_old: 13 My brethren from me He hath put far off, And mine acquaintances surely Have been estranged from me.

content: 14 Ceased have my neighbours And my familiar friends have forgotten me,
content_old: 14 Ceased have my neighbours And my familiar friends have forgotten me,

content: 15 Sojourners of my house and my maids, For a stranger reckon me: An alien I have been in their eyes.
content_old: 15 Sojourners of my house and my maids, For a stranger reckon me: An alien I have been in their eyes.

content: 16 To my servant I have called, And he doth not answer, With my mouth I make supplication to him.
content_old: 16 To my servant I have called, And he doth not answer, With my mouth I make supplication to him.

content: 17 My spirit is strange to my wife, And my favours to the sons of my mother’s womb.
content_old: 17 My spirit is strange to my wife, And my favours to the sons of my mother’s womb.

content: 18 Also sucklings have despised me, I rise, and they speak against me.
content_old: 18 Also sucklings have despised me, I rise, and they speak against me.

content: 19 Abominate me do all the men of my counsel, And those I have loved, Have been turned against me.
content_old: 19 Abominate me do all the men of my counsel, And those I have loved, Have been turned against me.

content: 21 Pity me, pity me, ye my friends, For the hand of God hath stricken against me.
content_old: 21 Pity me, pity me, ye my friends, For the hand of God hath stricken against me.

content: 22 Why do you pursue me as God? And with my flesh are not satisfied?
content_old: 22 Why do you pursue me as God? And with my flesh are not satisfied?

content: 23 Who doth grant now, That my words may be written? Who doth grant that in a book they may be graven?
content_old: 23 Who doth grant now, That my words may be written? Who doth grant that in a book they may be graven?

content: 24 With a pen of iron and lead—For ever in a rock they may be hewn.

content: 25 That—I have known my Redeemer, The Living and the Last, For the dust he doth rise.

content: 4 This hast thou known from antiquity? Since the placing of man on earth?
content_old: 4 This hast thou known from antiquity? Since the placing of man on earth?

content: 5 That the singing of the wicked is short, And the joy of the profane for a moment,
content_old: 5 That the singing of the wicked is short, And the joy of the profane for a moment,

content: 6 Though his excellency go up to the heavens, And his head against a cloud he strike—

content: 7 As his own dung for ever he doth perish, His beholders say: ‘Where is he?’

content_old: 8 As a dream he fleeth, and they find him not, And he is driven away as a vision of the night,

content: 9 The eye hath not seen him, and addeth not. And not again doth his place behold him.
content_old: 9 The eye hath not seen him, and addeth not. And not again doth his place behold him.

content: 10 His sons do the poor oppress, And his hands give back his wealth.

content: 11 His bones have been full of his youth, And with him on the dust it lieth down.
content_old: 11 His bones have been full of his youth, And with him on the dust it lieth down.

content: 12 Though he doth sweeten evil in his mouth, Doth hide it under his tongue,

content: 13 Hath pity on it, and doth not forsake it, And keep it back in the midst of his palate,
content_old: 13 Hath pity on it, and doth not forsake it, And keep it back in the midst of his palate,

content: 14 His food in his bowels is turned, The bitterness of asps is in his heart.

content: 15 Wealth he hath swallowed, and doth vomit it. From his belly God driveth it out.
content_old: 15 Wealth he hath swallowed, and doth vomit it. From his belly God driveth it out.

content: 16 Gall of asps he sucketh, Slay him doth the tongue of a viper.

content: 17 He looketh not on rivulets, Flowing of brooks of honey and butter.

content: 18 He is giving back what he laboured for, And doth not consume it; As a bulwark is his exchange, and he exults not.

content: 19 For he oppressed—he forsook the poor, A house he hath taken violently away, And he doth not build it.

content: 20 For he hath not known ease in his belly. With his desirable thing he delivereth not himself.
content_old: 20 For he hath not known ease in his belly. With his desirable thing he delivereth not himself.

content: 21 There is not a remnant to his food, Therefore his good doth not stay.
content_old: 21 There is not a remnant to his food, Therefore his good doth not stay.

content: 22 In the fulness of his sufficiency he is straitened. Every perverse hand doth meet him.

content: 23 It cometh to pass, at the filling of his belly, He sendeth forth against him The fierceness of His anger, Yea, He raineth on him in his eating.

content: 24 He fleeth from an iron weapon, Pass through him doth a bow of brass.

content: 25 One hath drawn, And it cometh out from the body, And a glittering weapon from his gall proceedeth. On him are terrors.

content: 26 All darkness is hid for his treasures, Consume him doth a fire not blown, Broken is the remnant in his tent.

content: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—
content_old: 1 And Job answereth and saith:—

content: 2 Hear ye diligently my word, And this is your consolation.
content_old: 2 Hear ye diligently my word, And this is your consolation.

content: 3 Bear with me, and I speak, And after my speaking—ye may deride.
content_old: 3 Bear with me, and I speak, And after my speaking—ye may deride.

content: 4 I—to man is my complaint? and if so, wherefore May not my temper become short?
content_old: 4 I—to man is my complaint? and if so, wherefore May not my temper become short?

content: 5 Turn unto me, and be astonished, And put hand to mouth.
content_old: 5 Turn unto me, and be astonished, And put hand to mouth.

content: 6 Yea, if I have remembered, then I have been troubled. And my flesh hath taken fright.
content_old: 6 Yea, if I have remembered, then I have been troubled. And my flesh hath taken fright.

content: 7 Wherefore do the wicked live? They have become old, Yea, they have been mighty in wealth.
content_old: 7 Wherefore do the wicked live? They have become old, Yea, they have been mighty in wealth.

content: 8 Their seed is established, Before their face with them, And their offspring before their eyes.
content_old: 8 Their seed is established, Before their face with them, And their offspring before their eyes.

content: 9 Their houses are peace without fear, Nor is a rod of God upon them.
content_old: 9 Their houses are peace without fear, Nor is a rod of God upon them.

content: 10 His bullock hath eaten corn, and doth not loath. His cow bringeth forth safely, And doth not miscarry.
content_old: 10 His bullock hath eaten corn, and doth not loath. His cow bringeth forth safely, And doth not miscarry.

content: 11 They send forth as a flock their sucklings, And their children skip,
content_old: 11 They send forth as a flock their sucklings, And their children skip,

content: 12 They lift themselves up at timbrel and harp, And rejoice at the sound of an organ.
content_old: 12 They lift themselves up at timbrel and harp, And rejoice at the sound of an organ.

content: 13 They wear out in good their days, And in a moment to Sheol go down.
content_old: 13 They wear out in good their days, And in a moment to Sheol go down.

content: 14 And they say to God, ‘Turn aside from us, And the knowledge of Thy ways We have not desired.
content_old: 14 And they say to God, ‘Turn aside from us, And the knowledge of Thy ways We have not desired.

content: 15 What is the Mighty One that we serve Him? And what do we profit when we meet with Him?’
content_old: 15 What is the Mighty One that we serve Him? And what do we profit when we meet with Him?’

content: 16 Lo, not in their hand is their good, (The counsel of the wicked Hath been far from me.)
content_old: 16 Lo, not in their hand is their good, (The counsel of the wicked Hath been far from me.)

content: 17 How oft is the lamp of the wicked extinguished, And come on them doth their calamity? Pangs He apportioneth in His anger.
content_old: 17 How oft is the lamp of the wicked extinguished, And come on them doth their calamity? Pangs He apportioneth in His anger.

content: 18 They are as straw before wind, And as chaff a hurricane hath stolen away,

content: 19 God layeth up for his sons his sorrow, He giveth recompense unto him—and he knoweth.
content_old: 19 God layeth up for his sons his sorrow, He giveth recompense unto him—and he knoweth.

content: 21 For what is his delight in his house after him, And the number of his months cut off?
content_old: 21 For what is his delight in his house after him, And the number of his months cut off?

content: 22 To God doth one teach knowledge, And He the high doth judge?
content_old: 22 To God doth one teach knowledge, And He the high doth judge?

content: 23 This one dieth in his perfect strength, Wholly at ease and quiet.
content_old: 23 This one dieth in his perfect strength, Wholly at ease and quiet.

content: 24 His breasts have been full of milk, And marrow his bones doth moisten.
content_old: 24 His breasts have been full of milk, And marrow his bones doth moisten.

content: 25 And this one dieth with a bitter soul, And have not eaten with gladness.

content: 26 Together—on the dust they lie down, And the worm doth cover them over.
content_old: 26 Together—on the dust they lie down, And the worm doth cover them over.

content: 27 Lo, I have known your thoughts, And the devices against me ye do wrongfully.

content_old: 28 For ye say, ‘Where is the house of the noble? And where the tent—The tabernacles of the wicked?’

content: 29 Have ye not asked those passing by the way? And their signs do ye not know?

content: 30 That to a day of calamity is the wicked spared. To a day of wrath they are brought.
content_old: 30 That to a day of calamity is the wicked spared. To a day of wrath they are brought.

content: 33 Sweet to him have been the clods of the valley, And after him every man he draweth, And before him there is no numbering.

content: 2 To God is a man profitable, Because a wise man to himself is profitable?
content_old: 2 To God is a man profitable, Because a wise man to himself is profitable?

content: 3 Is it a delight to the Mighty One That thou art righteous? is it gain, That thou makest perfect thy ways?
content_old: 3 Is it a delight to the Mighty One That thou art righteous? is it gain, That thou makest perfect thy ways?

content: 4 Because of thy reverence Doth He reason with thee? He entereth with thee into judgment:
content_old: 4 Because of thy reverence Doth He reason with thee? He entereth with thee into judgment:

content: 5 Is not thy wickedness abundant? And there is no end to thine iniquities.
content_old: 5 Is not thy wickedness abundant? And there is no end to thine iniquities.

content: 6 For thou takest a pledge of thy brother for nought, And the garments of the naked Thou dost strip off.
content_old: 6 For thou takest a pledge of thy brother for nought, And the garments of the naked Thou dost strip off.

content: 7 Thou causest not the weary to drink water, And from the hungry thou withholdest bread.
content_old: 7 Thou causest not the weary to drink water, And from the hungry thou withholdest bread.

content: 8 As to the man of arm—he hath the earth, And the accepted of face—he dwelleth in it.

content: 9 Widows thou hast sent away empty, And the arms of the fatherless are bruised.

content: 10 Therefore round about thee are snares, And trouble thee doth fear suddenly.
content_old: 10 Therefore round about thee are snares, And trouble thee doth fear suddenly.

content: 11 Or darkness—thou dost not see, And abundance of waters doth cover thee.

content: 15 The path of the age dost thou observe, That men of iniquity have trodden?

content: 16 Who have been cut down unexpectedly, A flood is poured out on their foundation.

content_old: 17 Those saying to God, ‘Turn aside from us,’ And what doth the Mighty One to them?

content_old: 23 If thou dost return unto the Mighty Thou art built up, Thou puttest iniquity far from thy tents.

content: 24 So as to set on the dust a defence, And on a rock of the valleys a covering.
content_old: 24 So as to set on the dust a defence, And on a rock of the valleys a covering.

content: 25 And the Mighty hath been thy defence, And silver is strength to thee.
content_old: 25 And the Mighty hath been thy defence, And silver is strength to thee.

content_old: 26 For then on the Mighty thou delightest thyself, And dost lift up unto God thy face,

content: 27 Thou dost make supplication unto Him, And He doth hear thee, And thy vows thou completest.

content: 10 Naked, they have gone without clothing, And hungry—have taken away a sheaf.

content_old: 3 For all the while my breath is in me, And the spirit of God in my nostrils.

content: 4 My lips do not speak perverseness, And my tongue doth not utter deceit.

content: 5 Pollution to me—if I justify you, Till I expire I turn not aside mine integrity from me.
content_old: 5 Pollution to me—if I justify you, Till I expire I turn not aside mine integrity from me.

content: 7 As the wicked is my enemy, And my withstander as the perverse.

content: 11 From overflowing floods he hath bound, And the hidden thing bringeth out to light.

content: 13 Man hath not known its arrangement, Nor is it found in the land of the living.

content: 16 It is not valued with pure gold of Ophir, With precious onyx and sapphire,

content: 17 Not equal it do gold and crystal, Nor is its exchange a vessel of fine gold.

content: 18 Corals and pearl are not remembered, The acquisition of wisdom is above rubies.

content_old: 3 In His causing His lamp to shine on my head, By His light I walk through darkness.
