content_old: 4 And Elihu hath waited earnestly beside Job with words, for they are older than he in days.

content: 5 And Elihu seeth that there is no answer in the mouth of the three men, and his anger burneth.
content_old: 5 And Elihu seeth that there is no answer in the mouth of the three men, and his anger burneth.

content: 6 And Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite answereth and saith:—Young I am in days, and ye are age Therefore I have feared, And am afraid of shewing you my opinion.
content_old: 6 And Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite answereth and saith:—Young I am in days, and ye are age Therefore I have feared, And am afraid of shewing you my opinion.

content: 7 I said: Days do speak, And multitude of years teach wisdom.
content_old: 7 I said: Days do speak, And multitude of years teach wisdom.

content: 8 Surely a spirit is in man, And the breath of the Mighty One Doth cause them to understand.
content_old: 8 Surely a spirit is in man, And the breath of the Mighty One Doth cause them to understand.

content: 9 The multitude are not wise, Nor do the aged understand judgment.
content_old: 9 The multitude are not wise, Nor do the aged understand judgment.

content: 10 Therefore I have said: Hearken to me, I do shew my opinion—even I.
content_old: 10 Therefore I have said: Hearken to me, I do shew my opinion—even I.

content: 11 Lo, I have waited for your words, I give ear unto your reasons, Till ye search out sayings.
content_old: 11 Lo, I have waited for your words, I give ear unto your reasons, Till ye search out sayings.

content: 12 And unto you I attend, And lo, there is no reasoner for Job, Or answerer of his sayings among you.
content_old: 12 And unto you I attend, And lo, there is no reasoner for Job, Or answerer of his sayings among you.

content: 13 Lest ye say, We have found wisdom, God doth thrust him away, not man.
content_old: 13 Lest ye say, We have found wisdom, God doth thrust him away, not man.

content: 14 And he hath not set in array words for me, And with your sayings I do not answer him.
content_old: 14 And he hath not set in array words for me, And with your sayings I do not answer him.

content: 15 (They have broken down, They have not answered again, They removed from themselves words.
content_old: 15 (They have broken down, They have not answered again, They removed from themselves words.

content: 16 And I have waited, but they do not speak, For they have stood still, They have not answered any more.)
content_old: 16 And I have waited, but they do not speak, For they have stood still, They have not answered any more.)

content: 17 I answer, even I—my share, I shew my opinion—even I.
content_old: 17 I answer, even I—my share, I shew my opinion—even I.

content: 18 For I have been full of words, Distressed me hath the spirit of my breast,
content_old: 18 For I have been full of words, Distressed me hath the spirit of my breast,

content: 19 Lo, my breast is as wine not opened, Like new bottles it is broken up.
content_old: 19 Lo, my breast is as wine not opened, Like new bottles it is broken up.

content: 20 I speak, and there is refreshment to me, I open my lips and answer.
content_old: 20 I speak, and there is refreshment to me, I open my lips and answer.

content: 21 Let me not, I pray you, accept the face of any, Nor unto man give flattering titles,
content_old: 21 Let me not, I pray you, accept the face of any, Nor unto man give flattering titles,

content: 1 And yet, I pray thee, O Job, Hear my speech and to all my words give ear.
content_old: 1 And yet, I pray thee, O Job, Hear my speech and to all my words give ear.

content: 2 Lo, I pray thee, I have opened my mouth, My tongue hath spoken in the palate.
content_old: 2 Lo, I pray thee, I have opened my mouth, My tongue hath spoken in the palate.

content: 3 Of the uprightness of my heart are my sayings, And knowledge have my lips clearly spoken.
content_old: 3 Of the uprightness of my heart are my sayings, And knowledge have my lips clearly spoken.

content: 4 The Spirit of God hath made me, And the breath of the Mighty doth quicken me.
content_old: 4 The Spirit of God hath made me, And the breath of the Mighty doth quicken me.

content: 5 If thou art able—answer me, Set in array before me—station thyself.
content_old: 5 If thou art able—answer me, Set in array before me—station thyself.

content: 6 Lo, I am, according to thy word, for God, From the clay I—I also, have been formed.
content_old: 6 Lo, I am, according to thy word, for God, From the clay I—I also, have been formed.

content: 7 Lo, my terror doth not frighten thee, And my burden on thee is not heavy.
content_old: 7 Lo, my terror doth not frighten thee, And my burden on thee is not heavy.

content: 8 Surely—thou hast said in mine ears, And the sounds of words I hear:
content_old: 8 Surely—thou hast said in mine ears, And the sounds of words I hear:

content: 9 ‘Pure am I, without transgression, Innocent am I, and I have no iniquity.
content_old: 9 ‘Pure am I, without transgression, Innocent am I, and I have no iniquity.

content: 10 Lo, occasions against me He doth find, He doth reckon me for an enemy to Him,
content_old: 10 Lo, occasions against me He doth find, He doth reckon me for an enemy to Him,

content: 11 He doth put in the stocks my feet, He doth watch all my paths.’
content_old: 11 He doth put in the stocks my feet, He doth watch all my paths.’

content: 12 Lo, in this thou hast not been righteous, I answer thee, that greater is God than man.
content_old: 12 Lo, in this thou hast not been righteous, I answer thee, that greater is God than man.

content: 13 Wherefore against Him hast thou striven, When for all His matters He answereth not?
content_old: 13 Wherefore against Him hast thou striven, When for all His matters He answereth not?

content: 14 For once doth God speak, and twice, (He doth not behold it.)
content_old: 14 For once doth God speak, and twice, (He doth not behold it.)

content: 15 In a dream—a vision of night, In the falling of deep sleep on men, In slumberings on a bed.
content_old: 15 In a dream—a vision of night, In the falling of deep sleep on men, In slumberings on a bed.

content: 16 Then He uncovereth the ear of men, And for their instruction sealeth:
content_old: 16 Then He uncovereth the ear of men, And for their instruction sealeth:

content: 17 To turn aside man from doing, And pride from man He concealeth.
content_old: 17 To turn aside man from doing, And pride from man He concealeth.

content: 18 He keepeth back his soul from corruption, And his life from passing away by a dart.
content_old: 18 He keepeth back his soul from corruption, And his life from passing away by a dart.

content: 19 And he hath been reproved With pain on his bed, And the strife of his bones is enduring.
content_old: 19 And he hath been reproved With pain on his bed, And the strife of his bones is enduring.

content: 20 And his life hath nauseated bread, And his soul desirable food.
content_old: 20 And his life hath nauseated bread, And his soul desirable food.

content: 21 His flesh is consumed from being seen, And high are his bones, they were not seen!
content_old: 21 His flesh is consumed from being seen, And high are his bones, they were not seen!

content: 22 And draw near to the pit doth his soul, And his life to those causing death.
content_old: 22 And draw near to the pit doth his soul, And his life to those causing death.

content: 23 If there is by him a messenger, An interpreter—one of a thousand, To declare for man his uprightness:
content_old: 23 If there is by him a messenger, An interpreter—one of a thousand, To declare for man his uprightness:

content: 24 Then He doth favour him and saith, ‘Ransom him from going down to the pit, I have found an atonement.’
content_old: 24 Then He doth favour him and saith, ‘Ransom him from going down to the pit, I have found an atonement.’

content: 25 Fresher is his flesh than a child’s, He returneth to the days of his youth.
content_old: 25 Fresher is his flesh than a child’s, He returneth to the days of his youth.

content: 26 He maketh supplication unto God, And He accepteth him. And he seeth His face with shouting, And He returneth to man His righteousness.
content_old: 26 He maketh supplication unto God, And He accepteth him. And he seeth His face with shouting, And He returneth to man His righteousness.

content: 27 He looketh on men, and saith, ‘I sinned, And uprightness I have perverted, And it hath not been profitable to me.
content_old: 27 He looketh on men, and saith, ‘I sinned, And uprightness I have perverted, And it hath not been profitable to me.

content: 28 He hath ransomed my soul From going over into the pit, And my life on the light looketh.’
content_old: 28 He hath ransomed my soul From going over into the pit, And my life on the light looketh.’

content: 29 Lo, all these doth God work, Twice—thrice with man,
content_old: 29 Lo, all these doth God work, Twice—thrice with man,

content: 30 To bring back his soul from the pit, To be enlightened with the light of the living.
content_old: 30 To bring back his soul from the pit, To be enlightened with the light of the living.

content: 31 Attend, O Job, hearken to me, Keep silent, and I—I do speak.
content_old: 31 Attend, O Job, hearken to me, Keep silent, and I—I do speak.

content: 32 If there are words—answer me, Speak, for I have a desire to justify thee.
content_old: 32 If there are words—answer me, Speak, for I have a desire to justify thee.

content: 1 And Elihu answereth and saith:
content_old: 1 And Elihu answereth and saith:

content: 2 Hear, O wise men, my words, And, O knowing ones, give ear to me.
content_old: 2 Hear, O wise men, my words, And, O knowing ones, give ear to me.

content: 3 For the ear doth try words, And the palate tasteth to eat.
content_old: 3 For the ear doth try words, And the palate tasteth to eat.

content: 4 Judgment let us choose for ourselves, Let us know among ourselves what is good.
content_old: 4 Judgment let us choose for ourselves, Let us know among ourselves what is good.

content: 5 For Job hath said, ‘I have been righteous, And God hath turned aside my right,
content_old: 5 For Job hath said, ‘I have been righteous, And God hath turned aside my right,

content: 6 Against my right do I lie? Mortal is mine arrow—without transgression.’
content_old: 6 Against my right do I lie? Mortal is mine arrow—without transgression.’

content: 7 Who is a man like Job? He drinketh scoffing like water,
content_old: 7 Who is a man like Job? He drinketh scoffing like water,

content: 8 And he hath travelled for company With workers of iniquity, So as to go with men of wickedness.
content_old: 8 And he hath travelled for company With workers of iniquity, So as to go with men of wickedness.

content: 9 For he hath said, ‘It doth not profit a man, When he delighteth himself with God.’
content_old: 9 For he hath said, ‘It doth not profit a man, When he delighteth himself with God.’

content: 10 Therefore, O men of heart, hearken to me; Far be it from God to do wickedness, And from the Mighty to do perverseness:
content_old: 10 Therefore, O men of heart, hearken to me; Far be it from God to do wickedness, And from the Mighty to do perverseness:

content: 11 For the work of man he repayeth to him, And according to the path of each He doth cause him to find.
content_old: 11 For the work of man he repayeth to him, And according to the path of each He doth cause him to find.

content: 12 Yea, truly, God doth not do wickedly, And the Mighty doth not pervert judgment.
content_old: 12 Yea, truly, God doth not do wickedly, And the Mighty doth not pervert judgment.

content: 13 Who hath inspected for Himself the earth? And who hath placed all the habitable world?
content_old: 13 Who hath inspected for Himself the earth? And who hath placed all the habitable world?

content: 14 If He doth set on him His heart, His spirit and his breath unto Him He gathereth.
content_old: 14 If He doth set on him His heart, His spirit and his breath unto Him He gathereth.

content: 15 Expire doth all flesh together, And man to dust returneth.
content_old: 15 Expire doth all flesh together, And man to dust returneth.

content: 16 And if there is understanding, hear this, Give ear to the voice of my words.
content_old: 16 And if there is understanding, hear this, Give ear to the voice of my words.

content: 17 Yea, doth one hating justice govern? Or the Most Just dost thou condemn?
content_old: 17 Yea, doth one hating justice govern? Or the Most Just dost thou condemn?

content: 18 Who hath said to a king—‘Worthless,’ Unto princes—‘Wicked?’
content_old: 18 Who hath said to a king—‘Worthless,’ Unto princes—‘Wicked?’

content: 19 That hath not accepted the person of princes, Nor hath known the rich before the poor, For a work of His hands are all of them.
content_old: 19 That hath not accepted the person of princes, Nor hath known the rich before the poor, For a work of His hands are all of them.

content: 20 In a moment they die, and at midnight Shake do people, and they pass away, And they remove the mighty without hand.
content_old: 20 In a moment they die, and at midnight Shake do people, and they pass away, And they remove the mighty without hand.

content: 21 For His eyes are on the ways of each, And all his steps He doth see.
content_old: 21 For His eyes are on the ways of each, And all his steps He doth see.

content: 22 There is no darkness nor death-shade, For workers of iniquity to be hidden there;
content_old: 22 There is no darkness nor death-shade, For workers of iniquity to be hidden there;

content: 23 For He doth not suffer man any more, To go unto God in judgment,
content_old: 23 For He doth not suffer man any more, To go unto God in judgment,

content: 24 He breaketh the mighty—no searching! And He appointeth others in their stead.
content_old: 24 He breaketh the mighty—no searching! And He appointeth others in their stead.

content: 25 Therefore He knoweth their works, And He hath overturned by night, And they are bruised.
content_old: 25 Therefore He knoweth their works, And He hath overturned by night, And they are bruised.

content: 26 As wicked He hath stricken them, In the place of beholders.
content_old: 26 As wicked He hath stricken them, In the place of beholders.

content: 27 Because that against right They have turned aside from after Him, And none of His ways have considered wisely,
content_old: 27 Because that against right They have turned aside from after Him, And none of His ways have considered wisely,

content: 28 To cause to come in unto Him The cry of the poor, And the cry of the afflicted He heareth.
content_old: 28 To cause to come in unto Him The cry of the poor, And the cry of the afflicted He heareth.

content: 29 And He giveth rest, and who maketh wrong? And hideth the face, and who beholdeth it? And in reference to a nation and to a man, It is the same.
content_old: 29 And He giveth rest, and who maketh wrong? And hideth the face, and who beholdeth it? And in reference to a nation and to a man, It is the same.

content: 30 From the reigning of a profane man, From the snares of a people;
content_old: 30 From the reigning of a profane man, From the snares of a people;

content: 31 For unto God hath any said: ‘I have taken away, I do not corruptly,
content_old: 31 For unto God hath any said: ‘I have taken away, I do not corruptly,

content: 32 Besides that which I see, shew Thou me, If iniquity I have done—I do not add?’
content_old: 32 Besides that which I see, shew Thou me, If iniquity I have done—I do not add?’

content: 33 By thee doth He recompense, That thou hast refused—That thou dost choose, and not I? And what thou hast known, speak.
content_old: 33 By thee doth He recompense, That thou hast refused—That thou dost choose, and not I? And what thou hast known, speak.

content: 34 Let men of heart say to me, And a wise man is hearkening to me.
content_old: 34 Let men of heart say to me, And a wise man is hearkening to me.

content: 35 Job—not with knowledge doth he speak, And his words are not with wisdom.
content_old: 35 Job—not with knowledge doth he speak, And his words are not with wisdom.

content: 36 My Father! let Job be tried—unto victory, Because of answers for men of iniquity,
content_old: 36 My Father! let Job be tried—unto victory, Because of answers for men of iniquity,

content: 1 And Elihu answereth and saith:—
content_old: 1 And Elihu answereth and saith:—

content: 2 This hast thou reckoned for judgment: Thou hast said—‘My righteousness is more than God’s?’
content_old: 2 This hast thou reckoned for judgment: Thou hast said—‘My righteousness is more than God’s?’

content: 3 For thou sayest, ‘What doth it profit Thee! What do I profit from my sin?’
content_old: 3 For thou sayest, ‘What doth it profit Thee! What do I profit from my sin?’

content: 4 I return thee words, and thy friends with thee,
content_old: 4 I return thee words, and thy friends with thee,

content: 5 Behold attentively the heavens—and see, And behold the clouds, They have been higher than thou.
content_old: 5 Behold attentively the heavens—and see, And behold the clouds, They have been higher than thou.

content: 6 If thou hast sinned, what dost thou against Him? And thy transgressions have been multiplied, What dost thou to Him?
content_old: 6 If thou hast sinned, what dost thou against Him? And thy transgressions have been multiplied, What dost thou to Him?

content: 7 If thou hast been righteous, What dost thou give to Him? Or what from thy hand doth He receive?
content_old: 7 If thou hast been righteous, What dost thou give to Him? Or what from thy hand doth He receive?

content: 8 For a man like thyself is thy wickedness, And for a son of man thy righteousness.
content_old: 8 For a man like thyself is thy wickedness, And for a son of man thy righteousness.

content: 9 Because of the multitude of oppressions They cause to cry out, They cry because of the arm of the mighty.
content_old: 9 Because of the multitude of oppressions They cause to cry out, They cry because of the arm of the mighty.

content: 10 And none said, ‘Where is God my maker? Giving songs in the night,
content_old: 10 And none said, ‘Where is God my maker? Giving songs in the night,

content: 11 Teaching us more than the beasts of the earth, Yea, than the fowl of the heavens He maketh us wiser.’
content_old: 11 Teaching us more than the beasts of the earth, Yea, than the fowl of the heavens He maketh us wiser.’

content: 12 There they cry, and He doth not answer, Because of the pride of evil doers.
content_old: 12 There they cry, and He doth not answer, Because of the pride of evil doers.

content: 13 Surely vanity God doth not hear, And the Mighty doth not behold it.
content_old: 13 Surely vanity God doth not hear, And the Mighty doth not behold it.

content: 14 Yea, though thou sayest thou dost not behold Him, Judgment is before Him, and stay for Him.
content_old: 14 Yea, though thou sayest thou dost not behold Him, Judgment is before Him, and stay for Him.

content: 15 And, now, because there is not, He hath appointed His anger, And He hath not known in great extremity.
content_old: 15 And, now, because there is not, He hath appointed His anger, And He hath not known in great extremity.

content: 1 And Elihu addeth and saith:—
content_old: 1 And Elihu addeth and saith:—

content: 2 Honour me a little, and I shew thee, That yet for God are words.
content_old: 2 Honour me a little, and I shew thee, That yet for God are words.

content: 3 I lift up my knowledge from afar, And to my Maker I ascribe righteousness.
content_old: 3 I lift up my knowledge from afar, And to my Maker I ascribe righteousness.

content: 4 For, truly, my words are not false, The perfect in knowledge is with thee.
content_old: 4 For, truly, my words are not false, The perfect in knowledge is with thee.

content: 5 Lo, God is mighty, and despiseth not, Mighty in power and heart.
content_old: 5 Lo, God is mighty, and despiseth not, Mighty in power and heart.

content: 6 He reviveth not the wicked, And the judgment of the poor appointeth;
content_old: 6 He reviveth not the wicked, And the judgment of the poor appointeth;

content: 7 He withdraweth not from the righteous His eyes, And from kings on the throne, And causeth them to sit for ever, and they are high,
content_old: 7 He withdraweth not from the righteous His eyes, And from kings on the throne, And causeth them to sit for ever, and they are high,

content: 8 And if prisoners in fetters They are captured with cords of affliction,
content_old: 8 And if prisoners in fetters They are captured with cords of affliction,

content: 9 Then He declareth to them their work, And their transgressions, Because they have become mighty,
content_old: 9 Then He declareth to them their work, And their transgressions, Because they have become mighty,

content: 10 And He uncovereth their ear for instruction, And saith that they turn back from iniquity.
content_old: 10 And He uncovereth their ear for instruction, And saith that they turn back from iniquity.

content: 11 If they do hear and serve, They complete their days in good, And their years in pleasantness.
content_old: 11 If they do hear and serve, They complete their days in good, And their years in pleasantness.

content: 12 And if they do not hearken, By the dart they pass away, And expire without knowledge.
content_old: 12 And if they do not hearken, By the dart they pass away, And expire without knowledge.

content: 13 And the profane in heart set the face, They cry not when He hath bound them.
content_old: 13 And the profane in heart set the face, They cry not when He hath bound them.

content: 14 Their soul dieth in youth, And their life among the defiled.
content_old: 14 Their soul dieth in youth, And their life among the defiled.

content: 15 He draweth out the afflicted in his affliction, And uncovereth in oppression their ear.
content_old: 15 He draweth out the afflicted in his affliction, And uncovereth in oppression their ear.

content: 16 And also He moved thee from a strait place, To a broad place—no straitness under it, And the sitting beyond of thy table Hath been full of fatness.
content_old: 16 And also He moved thee from a strait place, To a broad place—no straitness under it, And the sitting beyond of thy table Hath been full of fatness.

content: 17 And the judgment of the wicked thou hast fulfilled, Judgment and justice are upheld—because of fury,
content_old: 17 And the judgment of the wicked thou hast fulfilled, Judgment and justice are upheld—because of fury,

content: 18 Lest He move thee with a stroke, And the abundance of an atonement turn thee not aside.
content_old: 18 Lest He move thee with a stroke, And the abundance of an atonement turn thee not aside.

content: 19 Doth He value thy riches? He hath gold, and all the forces of power.
content_old: 19 Doth He value thy riches? He hath gold, and all the forces of power.

content: 20 Desire not the night, For the going up of peoples in their stead.
content_old: 20 Desire not the night, For the going up of peoples in their stead.

content: 21 Take heed—do not turn unto iniquity, For on this thou hast fixed Rather than on affliction.
content_old: 21 Take heed—do not turn unto iniquity, For on this thou hast fixed Rather than on affliction.

content: 22 Lo, God doth sit on high by His power, Who is like Him—a teacher?
content_old: 22 Lo, God doth sit on high by His power, Who is like Him—a teacher?

content: 23 Who hath appointed unto Him his way? And who said, ‘Thou hast done iniquity?’
content_old: 23 Who hath appointed unto Him his way? And who said, ‘Thou hast done iniquity?’

content: 24 Remember that thou magnify His work That men have beheld.
content_old: 24 Remember that thou magnify His work That men have beheld.

content: 25 All men have looked on it, Man looketh attentively from afar.
content_old: 25 All men have looked on it, Man looketh attentively from afar.

content: 26 Lo, God is high, And we know not the number of His years, Yea, there is no searching.
content_old: 26 Lo, God is high, And we know not the number of His years, Yea, there is no searching.

content: 27 When He doth diminish droppings of the waters, They refine rain according to its vapour,
content_old: 27 When He doth diminish droppings of the waters, They refine rain according to its vapour,

content: 28 Which clouds do drop, They distil on man abundantly.
content_old: 28 Which clouds do drop, They distil on man abundantly.

content: 29 Yea, doth any understand The spreadings out of a cloud? The noises of His tabernacle?
content_old: 29 Yea, doth any understand The spreadings out of a cloud? The noises of His tabernacle?

content: 30 Lo, He hath spread over it His light, And the roots of the sea He hath covered,
content_old: 30 Lo, He hath spread over it His light, And the roots of the sea He hath covered,

content: 31 For by them He doth judge peoples, He giveth food in abundance.
content_old: 31 For by them He doth judge peoples, He giveth food in abundance.

content: 32 By two palms He hath covered the light, And layeth a charge over it in meeting,
content_old: 32 By two palms He hath covered the light, And layeth a charge over it in meeting,

content: 1 Also, at this my heart trembleth, And it moveth from its place.
content_old: 1 Also, at this my heart trembleth, And it moveth from its place.

content: 2 Hearken diligently to the trembling of His voice, Yea, the sound from His mouth goeth forth.
content_old: 2 Hearken diligently to the trembling of His voice, Yea, the sound from His mouth goeth forth.

content: 3 Under the whole heavens He directeth it, And its light is over the skirts of the earth.
content_old: 3 Under the whole heavens He directeth it, And its light is over the skirts of the earth.

content: 4 After it roar doth a voice—He thundereth with the voice of His excellency, And He doth not hold them back, When His voice is heard.
content_old: 4 After it roar doth a voice—He thundereth with the voice of His excellency, And He doth not hold them back, When His voice is heard.

content: 5 God thundereth with His voice wonderfully, Doing great things and we know not.
content_old: 5 God thundereth with His voice wonderfully, Doing great things and we know not.

content: 6 For to snow He saith, ‘Be on the earth.’ And the small rain and great rain of His power.
content_old: 6 For to snow He saith, ‘Be on the earth.’ And the small rain and great rain of His power.

content: 7 Into the hand of every man he sealeth, For the knowledge by all men of His work.
content_old: 7 Into the hand of every man he sealeth, For the knowledge by all men of His work.

content: 8 And enter doth the beast into covert, And in its habitations it doth continue.
content_old: 8 And enter doth the beast into covert, And in its habitations it doth continue.

content: 9 From the inner chamber cometh a hurricane, And from scatterings winds—cold,
content_old: 9 From the inner chamber cometh a hurricane, And from scatterings winds—cold,

content: 10 From the breath of God is frost given, And the breadth of waters is straitened,
content_old: 10 From the breath of God is frost given, And the breadth of waters is straitened,

content: 11 Yea, by filling He doth press out a cloud, Scatter a cloud doth His light.
content_old: 11 Yea, by filling He doth press out a cloud, Scatter a cloud doth His light.

content: 12 And it is turning itself round by His counsels, For their doing all He commandeth them, On the face of the habitable earth.
content_old: 12 And it is turning itself round by His counsels, For their doing all He commandeth them, On the face of the habitable earth.

content: 13 Whether for a rod, or for His land, Or for kindness—He doth cause it to come.
content_old: 13 Whether for a rod, or for His land, Or for kindness—He doth cause it to come.

content: 14 Hear this, O Job, Stand and consider the wonders of God.
content_old: 14 Hear this, O Job, Stand and consider the wonders of God.

content: 15 Dost thou know when God doth place them, And caused to shine the light of His cloud?
content_old: 15 Dost thou know when God doth place them, And caused to shine the light of His cloud?

content: 16 Dost thou know the balancings of a cloud? The wonders of the Perfect in knowledge?
content_old: 16 Dost thou know the balancings of a cloud? The wonders of the Perfect in knowledge?

content: 17 How thy garments are warm, In the quieting of the earth from the south?
content_old: 17 How thy garments are warm, In the quieting of the earth from the south?

content: 18 Thou hast made an expanse with Him For the clouds—strong as a hard mirror!
content_old: 18 Thou hast made an expanse with Him For the clouds—strong as a hard mirror!

content: 19 Let us know what we say to Him, We set not in array because of darkness.
content_old: 19 Let us know what we say to Him, We set not in array because of darkness.

content: 20 Is it declared to Him that I speak? If a man hath spoken, surely he is swallowed up.

content_old: 4 ‘Hear, I pray thee, and I—I do speak, I ask thee, and cause thou me to know.’

content: 8 And now, take to you seven bullocks and seven rams, and go ye unto My servant Job, and ye have caused a burnt-offering to ascend for you; and Job My servant doth pray for you, for surely his face I accept, so as not to do with you folly, because ye have not spoken concerning Me rightly, like My servant Job.
